joxy.painter

Class Painter

  • java.lang.Object
    • joxy.painter.Painter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonSlabPainter, DarkEngravingPainter, InputFieldPainter, ProgressBarIndicatorPainter

    public abstract class Painter
extends Object
    The abstract super class of all painters. A painter is a class that is able to paint a certain object, for example a button slab.

    A painter always has a paint method. This super class encapsulates this method to introduce caching. A painter can also require data, such as colors or the opacity.

    Author:
    Thom Castermans, Willem Sonke

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(Graphics2D g2,
         int x,
         int y,
         int width,
         int height)
        Paints the object given the currently set data, using the Graphics2D object provided.

        If the data hasn't changed and the width and height are the same as for the previous call of this method, the object will be painted from the cache (unless USE_CACHING is false; in that case nothing will be cached).

        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D object to paint with.
        x - The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner.
        y - The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner.
        width - The desired width of the object.
        height - The desired height of the object.
